info.description:
Dotenv config
=============

Simple ``.env`` config loader with the possibility of casting types

|Build Status| |Coverage Status| |Python versions| |PyPi|

Installation
------------

.. code:: shell

    pip3 install dotenv-config  # or pip if python3 is your default interpreter

Usage
-----

All you need is instantiate ``Config`` class. By default it will look
for ``.env`` file at place where it was called. You can specify your
``.env`` locations like this:

.. code:: python

    from dotenv_config import Config

    config = Config('.env-test')

Load configration option with call of ``config``. By default loaded
options is strings:

.. code:: python

    some_str_option = config('SOME_OPTION_FROM_YOUR_ENV_FILE_OR_ENVIRONMENT')  # str

You can pass any callable to convert loaded value. For example, if you
has ``SOME_INT=123`` in your ``.env`` and need to load it as ``int``,
call ``config`` like this:

.. code:: python

    int_option = config('SOME_INT', int)
    # or
    int_option = config('SOME_INT', conversion=int)

You can load your options as booleans if you define them as ``0`` or
``1``. For example you have a ``TRUE_OPTION=1`` and ``FALSE_OPTION=0``:

.. code:: python

    true_option = config('TRUE_OPTION', bool)  # True
    false_option = config('FALSE_OPTION', bool)  # false

Also you can pass default value for situations when required options may
not exists:

.. code:: python

    some_value = config('SOME_VALUE', default='my english is bad')

If options does not exists and you does not provide default value config
will raise ``ConfigValueNotFound`` exception.
